chargeHist.descr: Criminal Damage to Property - Domestic Abuse Repeater

result.execSummary:
The defendant John D. Rueth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Impairment of Physical Condition, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence is imposed and stayed, if imposed defendant is granted huber privileges and 60 days to pay any outstanding financial obligations as ordered by the Court.
Consecutive to: Stayed sentence on Ct 4 in this same case
Concurrent with: Probation on Ct 4 in this same case as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Fine is on Ct 2 only.

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  The defendant shall have no contact with  Hannah Olson of any kind, without the approval of the agent and of Hannah's,  whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference at 02-16-2016 10:30 am.
Status conference at 02-25-2016 09:10 am.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person via video conference from Clark County Jail with Attorney Prior appearing in person in court.  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived reading of the complaint  Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing.   Request for bond modification to drop no contact denied. Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 09:10 am.

The defendant shall have no contact with  H.O. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  Defendant is not to be on or around the premises of W6675 Timber Lane Road or W6679 Timber Lane Road if the Victim, H.O. is there.    The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Initial appearance scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:40 am.
